title.text: HTTP Protocol Explained: What You Need to Know (2024)
title.voiceover: Welcome to our deep dive into the HTTP Protocol, the foundation of web communication. Whether you're a beginner or looking to refresh your knowledge, this video will break down HTTP in a simple and engaging way.
title.subtitle: Understanding Web Communication

overview.text:
Think of HTTP like a postal service for the web:
- Your browser is the sender,
- The server is the receiver,
- And the HTTP protocol is the set of rules that ensures your message (or request) is delivered correctly.

In simple terms:
HTTP = Request (What you want) + Response (What you get)
This formula is the backbone of how the web works.
overview.voiceover:
To understand HTTP, let’s use the analogy of a postal service. Your browser is like a sender writing a letter (the request), and the server is the receiver who sends back a response. The HTTP protocol is the set of rules that ensures this communication happens smoothly.

In simple terms, HTTP can be broken down into a formula:
HTTP = Request (What you want) + Response (What you get)
This is the foundation of how data travels across the web.

interactions.voiceover: The process begins when your browser sends an HTTP request to the web server, asking for a specific resource, like a webpage.
The web server receives the request and forwards it to the application to process.
The application generates the appropriate response, such as an HTML page or JSON data.
The application sends the response back to the web server.

Finally, the web server delivers the response to your browser, which displays the requested content. Curious about how HTTPS adds a layer of security to this process? Don’t forget to watch our video on HTTPS Explained!
